creator: archie@dellroad.org
text:
The JavaDoc on the website is not built with "external references", i.e.,
all classes outside of Batik are hot hot-linkable. This is normally done
using the -link flag to javadoc or <link> subtags in the ant task, e.g.
<link href="http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/api/"/>

This will help a lot and reduce the number of questions on the mailing list,
for example:

http://mail-archives.apache.org/eyebrowse/ReadMsg?listName=batik-users@xml.apache.org&msgId=1062715

In this case, because "org.w3c.dom.css.CSSStyleDeclaration" is not hotlinkable
from the Javadoc for SVGStylableElement.getSyle(), the poster could not
easily see his problem was a simple one of wrong number of parameters.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This is fixed in the build script.  I probably won't
update the JavaDoc until the next release (otherwise the
docs are out of sync - but I might do it at some point).
